“So, Stephanie, do you have any hobbies outside of the game?” Mark asked, looking over his menu.

“I said, do you have any hobbies?” he smiled.

“Oh, well, not really. I haven't really had a lot of time,” Steve told Mark.

Steve wasn't sure what he should pick, everything was so expensive. The guy offered to cover the meal for him but he didn't want to take advantage of this guy's kindness. Still, he took another sip of wine and looked on. Drinking alcohol was a good way to get tipsy fast, so he needed to get something else in his stomach.

“Is there anything you would be interested in, if you had the time?” Mark asked.

“I suppose getting into music what be fun. I'd love to be able to play the piano one day. What about yourself?” Steve tossed back.

“I'm a pretty big film buff. My dad would take me out to see the newest thing and the habit stuck with me as an adult,” Mark explained.

Steve and Mark talked a little about movies that they liked. It was a fun coincidence that they had the same taste in movies and really got the conversation going. The waiter soon came back and refilled their wine glasses and asked if they were ready to order. Steve realized he never figured out what to get, having gotten too caught up in the conversation. Mark, he found, was really easy to talk to.

Mark had him laughing and giggling all night, though it was hard to say how much of that was Mark and how much was the wine. Either way, Steve didn't mind.

It was a shock to Steve when the check arrived. The meal was over and it turned out that Steph had stood up Mark! Steve found himself getting a little upset at that. Mark was such a great guy and went to so much trouble.

“You okay?” Mark asked, looking concerned.

“Oh? Uh...yes. I just didn't expect it to be over so soon...” Steve told him.

Mark didn't look sad but Steve knew how he would feel if he set up a date and the girl never showed up. Mark clearly didn't want to make Steve uncomfortable with his disappointment, he concluded.

“Miller,” Steve replied.

“Stephanie Miller” she wrote, followed by an F to designate Steve as Female.

She asked him a series of personal questions that he did his best to answer. Dr. Wilson made notes and nodded as Steve spoke, finishing up in no time at all. Once they were finished, Steve was handed a little pill and a small bottle filled with more.

“Such a small thing, I hardly even see the point. Nothing this tiny could do anything noticeable,” he thought to himself before swallowing the powerful pill.

“Thank you very much. Here is your $200 for your first session. Keep up with your pills every morning and come into the clinic on Wednesday to continue. Based on some of he answers to your questions, I believe you are eligible to participate in more studies we are conduction. Let the secretary know when you come in if you are interested,” she told him.

June hand him $200 in cash and a business card for the clinic, which he took gratefully. With that much money for so little work, he was sure that he was going to do as many studies as he could.
133111121111111111111121112.title: Steve finds Linda entertaining a guest

choices: Steve decides to check the phone for more clues on Steph
Steve tries to call one of his friends
1331111211111111111111211121.content:
"So much money for so little work..." Steve remarked. Then he froze. "Work!"

He looked around the room as Linda came back from walking June out.

"Do you have a laptop, I need to check my email!" Steve exclaimed. "I have to tell my job what happened last night."

"Can't you check it on your phone?" Linda asked.

"It's uh... not working right at the moment." Steve replied, not wanting to tell her about her brother's botched date.

"Okay." Linda said, grabbing her laptop from the table and signing in, before handing it to Steve.

He logged into his email and the first email was from his boss. The subject line wasn't promising.

Stephen Miller - Termination. He quickly opened the email.

Dear Stephen,

This letter is to inform you that your employment with will end as of today.

You have been terminated for the following reason(s):

Repeated disciplinary infractions

This decision is not reversible.

You will receive your final paycheck at the regular date of payment.

Respectfully,
HR

"Repeated disciplinary infractions?" Steve asked. "I didn't do anything..."

Steve thought, maybe Stephanie used his phone and got him fired. But he didn't have much time to think because the emotional floodgates opened up again and he felt like bawling.

"What's wrong?" Linda asked.

"I got fired..." Steve muttered.

"Oh, that's too bad." Linda replied. "And after all you've been through."

"I know... I don't even know why." Steve said.

"Don't worry about it, you have savings right?" she asked.

"A little, but not enough to live on very long." Steve said.

"Don't worry, I like you, and Mark likes you, so we'll help you out." Linda said.

"I really appreciate it." Steve hugged Linda.

"Anytime." Linda said. "Say, do you have anyone that you should check in on? After the fire and all, so they know you're all right?"

"That's a good idea, I nearly forgot!" Steve exclaimed. "I'm gonna go do that right now."

Steve rushed back to his room and pulled out the phone. He opened up the contacts list before he remembered that it wasn't his phone, though he did know some friends' numbers by heart.

"Hmm... I could see if there are more clues about Steph... or I could check in and make sure everyone knows I'm okay." Steve mused.
1331111211111111111111211121.title: Steve signs into his work email, and finds out ...

13311112111111111111112111211.content:
Steve sat on his bed and went looking through the phone for some clue as to where he should start looking for the woman next. Checking the schedule for the day he saw a Doctor's appointment.

“Great! I can shoot two birds with one stone,” he said excited.

Looking again, he saw that the appointment was soon, however. Realizing that he had better run, he grabbed his purse, since he didn't have pockets, and rushed out of his room. He told Linda that he had to Uber to the doctor's but she insisted that he let her drop him off to save the money. Grateful, he thanked her for the help. He could tell that this living situation was going to work out but he was going to have to make sure he was going to be able to pull his own weight and pitch in around the apartment.

The doctor's office wasn't far but it was coming down to the wire and unfortunately, there was traffic just out outside of the parking lot. Not wanting to miss his chance, Steve and Linda decided that it would be faster if he ran the rest of the way and that is what he did.

Steve came running up to the office but slowed down to a brisk walk so not to look crazy though he was breathing very heavy. Behind the desk was a young woman that adjusted her glasses as he came in.

“Hi there, how can I help you?” she asked pleasantly.

Steve did his best to get out that he was there to see Stephanie before her appointment. The woman typed into the computer looking for an appointment for Stephanie and pulled it up and signed Steve in.

“Got it, have a seat please,” She told him.

Glad he didn't miss the woman yet, Steve sat down and caught his breath. He sat for a long while before concluding that she wasn't coming, after all. Still, he should still about his his own appointment while he was there. He was about to do just that when a woman came out of a door into the waiting room. She looked at her clipboard and then spoke.

“Stephanie?” she said before looking at Steve, the only one there.

“Oh, hi. I was actually-” Steve said.

“Come this way,” she told him in a thick accent of some kind before he could explain.

He got up, a bit confused and followed her into a room and had him step on a scale. He followed directions why trying to explain why he was there as well as the day he had. The pond water and the stings. She took his blood pressure and made notes, though he wasn't sure she understood, exactly. She left and instructed him to strip and put on a medical gown, which he did. Soon after, the doctor arrived and sat down reading Steve's file.

“So, you are having some swelling?” he asked.

“Yes, that's right,” Steve told him.

“Let's take a look. Could you pull down the top?” He asked.

Steve pulled down his top and then remembered he was wearing the bra. His face went red with embarrassment.

“I...got this yesterday...because of the swelling, you know? It has been helping my back,” Steve attempted to explain through his embarrassment.

“That was a good idea. I recommend you get some more. It can only help. Could you take it off for now?,” he explained to Steve's who was happy not to be shamed.

Steve struggled to remove it but eventually got it. The doctor examined his chests, squeezing the mounds and asking about pain. Steve did notice how sensitive they felt, chills running down his spine as the doctor's fingers explored.

“Everything looks normal here, I prescribe you a few things and you should be feeling better. Could you turn around and bend a little?” He asked.

Steve did, thinking that the doctor wanted to see the rest of the swelling. What happened was the doctor injected something into his backside.

“Talk to the receptionist for your scripts and to set up your following appointments,” He told Steve.

After the doctor left, Steve dressed before going to the receptionist. He did as he was told and, script in hand, headed to the pharmacy.
13311112111111111111112111211.title: Steve decides to check the phone for more clues...

choices: Steve spots someone he knows at the diner
Steve's phone buzzes with another task to do
133111121111111111111121112111.content:
Steve was relieved it wasn't anything more serious and texted Linda that he was walking to the pharmacy, which was a few blocks down. He went in and picked up the prescription, leaving with a few bottles of pills that he put into his purse. As he exited, he heard a car horn honk. He looked up to see Mark's car sitting at the curb.

"Need a lift?" Mark asked.

"How'd you know I'd be here?" Steve asked as he climbed into the car.

"I swung by Linda's, but she told me you had gone to the doctor's and then the pharmacy, so I figured I'd swing by and see what you were up to." Mark replied as he started driving.

"That's nice of you." Steve said.

"Just about time for brunch, do you want to go get something to eat?" Mark asked.

Steve's stomach rumbled. He probably should get some food in him today. He hasn't had anything since last night's dinner.

"Oh, I couldn't impose. Two meals in two days." Steve refused.

"Come on, you had a rough night, just got out of a doctor's appointment. My treat, and I won't take no for an answer." Mark stated.

"Can't argue with that logic." Steve giggled.

Soon they were at a diner, eating, laughing, as Mark recounted a story about a former roommate and a coconut, and Steve was even having a mimosa. Mark had recommended it, and it felt good to have an excuse to day drink after the night and morning he had. While they ate:
133111121111111111111121112111.title: Steve meets up with Mark

choices: Natalie realizes that the woman is Steve
Embarrassed at not knowing who she is, Natalie pretends to remember "the woman"
1331111211111111111111211121111.content:
After one particularly funny joke left Steve hand gabbing for anything to grip on to for support, which ended up being Mark's thigh. In that innocent motion, Steve's hand had gripped onto something else in Mark's pant which Steve didn't notice but Mark certainly did. It was during that moment that Steve saw someone out of the corner of his eye.

==========

Natalie was watching the cute couple flirting with each other from across the diner with just a pinch of jealousy. When the woman spotted her looking, Natalie looked away, embarrassed but still stealing glances out of the corner of her eye. The woman got up and assured her boyfriend that she would be back with a rub of his hand and then started head toward Natalie.

“Hey Nat,” She said sashaying over.

“Uh...hi,” Natalie said, taken aback.

“It's good to see you. So much has happened, I don't even know where to start,” she said, sitting down with Natalie.

Natalie was sure she had seen this woman before. That was why she was looking at her in the first place. The woman was telling her a story but Natalie couldn't keep up, her mind too preoccupied. The woman was pretty. Really pretty, which even Natalie had to admit.

==========

“And now I don't know what to do,” Steve finished.

It felt good to unburden himself to her. He and Natalie had been friends for years and she was on his list of people to call. She couldn't figure out how to respond, which Steve understood why. He talked with her a little bit and gave her the phone's number for the time being.
1331111211111111111111211121111.title: Steve spots someone he knows at the diner

choices: The phone shows a new message
13311112111111111111112111211111.content:
Natalie looked into the woman's eyes and suddenly, things clicked into place. She was extremely shocked and was speechless for a moment.
===========

"Nat?" Steve asked.

"Steve... I..." Natalie started to reply. "I hardly recognized you..."

Steve was confused until he remembered what he was wearing. He looked down and saw the exercise pants and t-shirt.

"Oh, yeah, the outfit. That's cause my apartment burned down and Linda, Mark's sister, was good about lending me something to wear." Steve said.

"Right..." Natalie replied, trying to piece together what was going on.

=====================

Natalie wondered, it had been a while since she had seen Steve, a few weeks at least, but he never said anything about wanting to be a woman before. She'd never have guessed, but based on how she was acting with the guy, she guessed that was Mark, that this must be what Steve wants. Why else would he be dressed like this in public? She entertained the notion of blackmail or a bet, but the way that Steve was acting with that man... he was enjoying it. Natalie was certain of it. And if this is what her friend wanted... she wasn't going to judge. Male or female, Steve was a friend. Or was he going by something different now?

================
Steve was so relieved to finally see a familiar face. He was also happy that Natalie didn't seem to be judging the strange way he looked. She was a good friend like that, not going to say anything to embarrass him.

"Do you need money or anything?" Nat asked.

"Not right now, I've got some savings." Steve replied. "But I just wanted to make sure that you'd know I was okay, in case you had heard. Feel free to tell anyone else that asks about me."

Only seemed fair to let her give the news, in case a mutual friend reached out to her if they couldn't find him.
================
Natalie surmised that he must be out of the closet, if he's not asking her to keep quiet. And good on him... her, whichever it was. She certainly didn't expect this when she saw the couple, but she's happy for Steve.

"Anyway, I've got to get back to Mark, but it was great seeing you. Feel free to reach out." Steve said as he got up and walked back to his table.
================
Mark smiled when Steve returned to the table.

"How's your friend?" Mark asked.

"Good, I think. Seemed a bit weird at first, but I think it was just my outfit." Steve replied.

"I don't think you look that bad. Bit of a lazy day look, but I like it." Mark laughed.

"Oh, stop it." Steve giggled and playfully slapped Mark's arm.

As he did, Steve's phone buzzed again. Steve dug into the purse and pulled it out, seeing:
13311112111111111111112111211111.title: Natalie realizes that the woman is Steve

choices: She was going to interview as a secretary
She was going to interview for a maid position
133111121111111111111121112111111.content:
Feeling the phone buzz, Steve pulls it out and take a look to see a notification. It looked like the phone's owner had a job interview later. Steve frowned at the reminder that he was unemployed himself.

“What is it?” Mark asks Steve.

“Oh, it's a reminder...on my phone,” Steve tells him, not wanting to bring up Steph in front of him.

Steve was about to open up the phone to see the reminder's details but before he could, someone bumped their table. The table shook and Steve's glass knocked over into his lap, covering him in soda. The man that did it profusely apologized but Steve assured him it was fine and an accident. Steve patted himself down and offered Mark a week smile and a shrug.

“You want to head back and get changed?” Mark asked.

“Yeah, I guess I should,” Steve frowned.

He didn't know what he was going to do once he got there, though. There weren't really many options for him to get changed into. He figured he would think of something, though. Mark payed and the two of them left, hand in hand. Steve waved to Natalie, you still couldn't believe what she was seeing as the couple left. Once they got back to the apartment, Steve looked back at Mark.

“You are really great, you know that,” Steve said before squeezing his hand and getting out of the car.

Linda was on her way out when Steve got to the door.

“Oh good, here,” She said handing over a key.

“Thank you. I really appreciate everything you've been doing for me.,” Steve said, feeling overwhelmed by the trust he was being given.

“It's no trouble at all. Anyway, I've got to go. I'll see you later,” Linda told him.

They parted ways and Steve when to get a quick shower. He used the products that Linda had passed his way, feeling a little silly but still wanted to be clean. Once done and smelling like a flower, Steve started to get dressed.

He put on a pair of panties and put the bra back on, taking note that he was going to need more. He was wondering if Linda's might fit when his attention came back to the phone. He opened it up and started looking at the details. Maybe he could finally meet up with her, he thought.
133111121111111111111121112111111.title: The phone shows another task

choices: Forget the interview and try on some more outfits
1331111211111111111111211121111111.content:
Steve hoped that she'd actually show up to this, since she's been AWOL since he got the phone. He scrolled through the job interview, checking out where it was located.

"Looks like an office job..." Steve mused as he scrolled through. "Uh huh... secretarial position. Don't think she's exactly qualified with how delinquent she's been over the last day."

Steve giggled to himself as he glanced back over at the clothes. He started going through the box, separating out some bras to try on later, before turning his attention to what clothing he had available. He had hoped he could find something vaguely masculine until he had disposable income to replace his own belongings.

After a few minutes he had everything separated into categories. Underwear and socks went to the side, and he started looking into everything else. The dresses were out, some of them looked nice, but he wasn't going to wear one unless he was that desperate again. He found one nice suit jacket, a feminine cut, but serviceable, the only possible issue was that it was a bright purple. Unfortunately, there were no matching pants, and no pants of any kind apart from the exercise pants he had been wearing. Only dresses and skirts. Steve picked up a black skirt and entertained the idea.

"Well, I was wearing a dress yesterday, so what difference does a skirt make?" he asked himself. "No one said anything then..."

There were also several button-down shirts that would work even without the jacket. He found an off-white, vaguely pinkish shirt, and held it next to the blazer.

"Hmm..." Steve debated.

He tried on the outfit and checked how it looked. It was comfortable and he looked okay in it. As he slipped on his shoes to test, the phone buzzed again. A reminder about the interview. If he wanted to catch her before she went in, he had to go now!
1331111211111111111111211121111111.title: She was going to interview as a secretary

choices: A week of pills and work
13311112111111111111112111211111111.content:
Not wanting to miss the chance, Steve grabbed his purse and headed to the office. Hopefully he would get finally get his own phone back, but at this point, he wasn't sure that was going to happen anymore. Either way, doing anything beat doing nothing. He ordered an uber and, once arrived, headed to the office.

Steve thanked the driver for the ride and took in the site of the building. It was new, it seemed. shiny and modern in design. Steve wondered what kinds of things they did there as he entered through the glass door. The giant desk in the center of the lobby was dwarfed by the size of the lobby itself. The clack of Steve's heels echoed with each step as he made his way to the overworked woman behind the huge desk.

“Hi, I'm looking-” Steve started to say before being cut off.

The woman held up a finger and answered the a ringing phone before putting them on hold.

“There is an interview for Stephanie-” He tried again before getting cut off again.

The same thing happened once more. The finger. The phone. Putting on hold. One more time he tried before being told to sit in one of the chairs along the wall. Steve took the seat, crossing his smooth legs, frustrated at the situation. Steve sat there for a long while, going through the phone and bobbing his foot up and down, before the secretary called out to him.

“Last name?” she asked him.

“Miller. I'm here to-” he started before being cut off again with that damn finger.

Again Steve waited with the phone before a man came out from a side door. He looked over at Steve and grinned, looking him up and down. He reached into his pocket as subtly as he could, readjusting himself. He knew already that he was going to hire this person in the sexy skirt.

“Ms. Miller?” he asked hopefully.

“Yes,” Steve said hearing his last name.

“Please, come this way,” he said.

Steve got up, confused, but followed. The inside of the building was just as impressive as the outside. Steve was lead into an office with an expensive looking desk topped with a name plate. Albert White: CEO.

“Have a seat please,” he told Steve.

Steve did, waiting for an opportunity to speak. Again he sat, his long legs crossed but now across from the CEO. Albert stole glances at Steve's legs as he went through a file on his computer.

“Everything here checks out. Which is great because I could really use your help. Would you be willing to start today?” he ask, cracking his fingers.

“Start today?” Steve asked, not sure what he was talking about.
“I could use someone to man the phone and sort through some backed up emails. Can you do that for me today?” he asked, still grinning.

“I...sure?” Steve responded, taken off guard.

“Wonderful. You are hired then. Welcome aboard. Let me show you to your desk,” he said getting up.

Steve stood, bewildered. He had a job? This was wonderful! He happily followed Mr. White to his new desk. He was instructed of his duties and was informed of the pay. When he heard the dollar amount, he was floored. He was going to be back on his feet in no time!

Steve got to work, going through emails and answering calls. Occasionally he caught sight of Mr. White watching him, making sure he wasn't slacking off. He would smile when he noticed him, assuring him he was grateful for the position of assistant. Steve felt great after putting in an honest days work.
13311112111111111111112111211111111.title: Head to the interview

choices: Steve and Linda meet with the landlord
Mark invited Steve and Linda out for dinner
133111121111111111111121112111111111.content:
Steve was really getting the hang of working with the longer nails, though he hoped he'd be able to fix them once he had time. No rush though, since it wasn't impeding his work. Once it was quitting time, Steve started to pack his things. Mr. White poked his head out of the door of his office and smiled at Steve.

"See you bright and early Monday morning?" Mr. White asked.

"Of course, sir." Steve replied.

"Great!" Mr. White returned to his office.

The phone buzzed on Steve's desk and he picked it up and checked it. It was a text from Linda.

"Hey, just want to let you know that if you're staying, we have to meet with the landlord ASAP." Linda wrote.

"Just getting out of work now. I got a job, btw!" Steve texted back.

"You did? That's great!" Linda replied.

"Thanks! See you when I get home." Steve sent.

Steve closed the messenger app and sent for an Uber, having it drop him off at the apartment building.

When Steve arrived back in the apartment:
133111121111111111111121112111111111.title: The phone buzzes again

choices: Steve finds someone else out there
133111121111111111111121112111111112.content:
A week later, things were going great for Steve! The job was going well, Mr. White was a great boss, Steve had even made a few friends with the other assistants, living with Linda was great, and Steve had been feeling much better ever since he started taking the pills the doctor prescribed. That and whatever was in that pill that Linda's friend June had given him. Which reminded Steve, June was dropping by today to check in on his progress after the first week.

Steve stretched his arms out as he woke up. He finally felt normal again, sort-of, even if it had just been a week. The phone buzzed and Steve picked it up, a text from Natalie, asking if he wanted to hit the mall with her.

Steve glanced over at the box of Linda's clothes and texted back that he'd love to, gotta pick up some new clothes for himself. Can't live off of Linda's kindness forever! He got up out of bed, and remembered that he had forgotten to wash those exercise pants, and he didn't want to sleep in his underwear, so he had checked the box and found a nightgown to sleep in. He reasoned that it was no different than the red dress hanging up in his closet, so he wore it to bed.

As he brushed his teeth, he mused that, "I've got to try to track down this woman again. None of the leads have led to her, and I've gotta get this phone back to her so I can have mine back!"

He spit into the sink and headed out into the kitchen to get something to eat.
133111121111111111111121112111111112.title: A week of pills and work

1331111211111111111111211121111111121.content:
With his teeth all brushed, Steve went out to the kitchen. Predictably, Linda was already there, getting some breakfast prepared.

"Morning, sleeping beauty," Linda smiled with a little giggle, noticing his sleepwear. "That looks pretty good on you. Really suits your figure."

"Thanks," Steve smiled, even giggling a little himself.

Honestly, it had been a funny week. Sure, everything seemed to be going well, especially with work and how he was making friends and all that. In addition to that though, there were the occasional odd things. Like, maybe it was just him, but it seemed like his hair was considerably longer than it had been before. It was a little long before when he started pulling it back into a small ponytail, but now it reached his shoulders easily. It was pretty strange, although everyone seemed to like how it looked on him. No doubt using Linda's hair shampoo helped with that. Steve didn't mind it.

Aside from that though, there was the swelling in his chest, which hadn't gone down at all, although it did feel a little more bearable. In fact, that was one reason Steve thought about going shopping. The bra he had been wearing all this time was starting to feel small. He had little knowledge of the sizes of women's bras, but he had a feeling the ones he had from her were too small. He wished he didn't have swelling at all, but might as well try to make himself comfortable while he could.

"So, any other plans for the day?" Linda asked as she got him a plate of breakfast.

"Well, Natalie texted me. Wanted me to come to the mall to shop," he said. "I figured I should eventually."

"Ah, that's good," Linda smiled. "My clothes will probably only work for so long after all. They don't do your figure justice."

"Oh you," Steve giggled a little and playfully touched her arm, getting a laugh from them both.

"Still, it's great news," Linda said. "You think you can hold off on that until a little later? I assume you remember June is coming over today to check on you, and she should be on her way soon. You don't mind doing that first right?"

"No, not at all," Steve nodded. "We can shop during the midday."

"Good call," Linda smiled.

With that, the two of them finished breakfast, and Steve again had his pills with something to drink. It wondered to Steve how these pills were doing, as he was taking pills from both June and Stephanie's doctor. Still, he felt great so he assumed whatever he was doing wasn't going to kill him.

In any case, he finished breakfast and then went to shower as usual. He had gotten hooked on Linda's shower supplies, so much that he had gotten some similar ones for himself. The flowery scent actually relaxed him as he washed. Upon finishing that, he got on another pair of panties with a bra, struggling a little with said bra due to it being smaller than he needed now. Finishing the ensemble was a nice little lilac shirt with a white skirt. Skirts had surprisingly become easier for him due to working all week in them. Even walking in heels was easier thanks to his date with Mark and said work.

"Okay, all good to go," he smiled, letting his hair flow straight instead of putting it in a ponytail. He wasn't working today after all.
1331111211111111111111211121111111121.title: Steve chats with Linda

13311112111111111111112111211111111211.content:
When June arrived, she sat down with Steve in the living room. She took a clipboard out of her bag and started asking questions.

"First off, how have you felt since you started taking the pill?" she asked.

"Great!" Steve replied. "Never better!"

"That's good..." June notated on the clipboard.

"Say, are you allowed to tell me what the pill does?" Steve asked.

"We'd prefer if you didn't know, it's a very hush-hush trial. There are a lot of competitors around, you know?" June responded. "What I can say is that it's related to overall health."

"Makes sense." Steve said. He wasn't sure what that meant, but he trusted June.

"Right, have you noticed any changes in the past week?"

"None that I can think of. I started taking other pills from a doctor, but I don't think they're interacting."

"All right... And if you don't mind, I'd like to take a blood sample." June said.

"No problem at all." Steve held out his arm as June took out a needle and quickly drew blood.

"Okay, that should be everything. Next week, I'll have you come in to the office so we can do an official check-in, okay?"

"Sounds good." Steve replied.

June packed up her things and left, satisfied with how Ms. Miller was progressing. She should start to show signs over the next week, Linda promised to keep her apprised. Steve texted Natalie and let her know that he was ready when she was, for their day out.
13311112111111111111112111211111111211.title: June arrives for the check-up

133111121111111111111121112111111112111.content:
Natalie took very little time to respond, saying that she'd meet Steve at the entrance to the mall. That seemed good enough to Steve, so he sent a reply back to agree before putting the phone away.

"Have fun on your trip." Linda smiled and waved a little.

"You bet!" Steve smiled as well as he left.

He went out and began driving towards the mall. He wasn't sure why, but he just felt really good now. Everything seemed to be getting better after feeling like he hit rock bottom just a little while ago, and now he was even going to spend some time with Natalie, one of the few old friends he really had at this point. Just the idea of some shopping with her made him feel a little giddy, which was kind of odd. He never felt that involving any shopping before, but then again, he was open to new things.

Eventually, he arrived at the shopping mall, parking where he could and beginning to walk towards the entrance. Natalie was easy to pick out, and Steve smiled as he came over.

"Hi Natalie. Nice to see you," he smiled.

"Yeah, likewise," Natalie said after a small pause.

Boy, from her perspective, Steve looked really girly now. That hair looked very well taken care of, and his bust looked distinctive against his swollen chest, though even she could see the bra was undersized. Needless to say, she was pretty confused about the whole thing. But then again, it was Steve's choice, and he seemed pretty happy about it.

If he was happy, then she could too, right?

"So, what would you like to see first?" Natalie prompted.

"Oh, anywhere's good," Steve smiled. "Though...you think we could perhaps get something better for my chest. It's...really tight at the moment."

"That's a good idea," Natalie nodded a little. "Last thing you need is a bra that's too small. Let's....go for that first...and maybe see what other clothes you like. You mentioned getting a better wardrobe, right?"

"Yeah, I don't want to take advantage of Linda all the time," Steve said. "It'd be good to have some of my own stuff, and we should have enough money too. The new secretary job I have pays very well."

"Wow....sounds like you have quite a story..." Natalie smiled softly.
133111121111111111111121112111111112111.title: Out with Natalie

1331111211111111111111211121111111121113.content: So, what else could happen?
1331111211111111111111211121111111121113.title: Something else happens

13311112111111111111112111211111111213.content:
Just then, Lydia’s phone rang.

“Sorry, Steph,” She apologizes before accepting the call. “Oh, hey June! What’s up?” She paused for a moment, and then nodded. “Oh, yes, of course! I’ll let Steph know to come to your office instead.”

She hangs up and puts her phone back into her pocket before turning to you. “Hey, June is wondering if you’d be able to go their building instead. Something came up, I guess.”

You shrug. “Alright!”

It takes about fifteen minutes for you to get to June’s work. A little nervous, you walk inside, and a peppy receptionist greets you. “Hi! You must be Ms. Miller! Right this way please.”

A little confused, you follow after her, unconsciously swaying your hips side to side as you walk. You walk through a few different hallways, but finally she stops at a door.

“Head on inside.”

A little nervous, you step inside, and are greeted by June. “Steph! How are you feeling? Have you been taking your pills daily?”

Honestly, your chest and butt both feel itchy now, but you suppose that’s just a brief side effect. “Is that why I had to come in?”

Steve headed to the kitchen and was surprised to see Mark sitting with Linda at the table. A smile spread wide on his handsome face as Mark watched Steve enter.

“Mark, hi. It's good to see you. What are you doing here?” Steve's own smile rivaled Mark's.

Mark stood and took a step toward Steve, “I was in the area and thought I'd drop by and say hello.”

Linda smirked seeing the two of them interact and got up as well. She moved passed Mark and Steve and grabbed her purse, slinging it over her shoulder.

“Well, I think I'll leave you kids alone. June will be here soon so don't you two get too distracted,” Linda waved and left the apartment.

“Sorry about her,” Mark shrugged, embarrassed by his sister's comment.

“Don't be.”

They stood in silence for a short moment while Steve started to notice that Mark wanted to say something.

“So...uh...I haven't heard from you. Is everything alright?” Mark cautiously mentioned.

“Oh, sorry. I've been really busy with the new job and everything.”

“It's okay, I know you've got a lot on your plate right now. I didn't know if...uh, I just thought that maybe...If you'd like maybe we could...do...something” Mark's face dropped as he felt himself fumble around.

“Are you asking me out?” Steve giggled, striking a forced feminine pose.

Mark placed his hand to his temple, feeling silly for being as bashful as he was.

“I'd love to. I'll be free tonight if that's not too soon,” Steve told him.

“Oh! Tonight's works for me. I'll pick you up at six?” Mark asked excitedly making his way to the door.

“I look forward to it.”

“Thank you,” she took the glass and had a sip as Steve sat across from her.

“Now, lets get started. Are you having any problems or irritation anywhere?”

“No, I've been fine.”

“Good. Have you noticed any changes?” she asked, attempting to not look hopeful.

“Actually, now that you mention it, I think I might. My skin feels kind of different since we started,” he said running his fingers along his arm.

“Any pain or discomfort?” she typed away.

“A little. Everything feels a bit more sensitive lately. I feel a little colder than usual but other things have been nicer.”

“Such as?” she asked looking up from her screen.

Steven decided to not talk about how nice Linda's clothes have been feeling on his body and instead settled for talking about the blankets at night. They spoke more about small things that he had not really thought about. His body's scent smelled a bit different but that was hard to say if it was him or the toiletries he had been given. The same could be said about his hair, which was shinier and softer.

“I guess the only other thing I can mention is my general anxiety has gone down, too. I just feel more relaxed and kind of 'go with the flow' more. Could that be related?”

“I can't say but I am glad you have been feeling better,” she told him, writing that down. Once she finished up and shut down her laptop, she gathered some things from her bag and handed him a piece of paper.

“What is this?” Steve asked.

“It's a website address, Account name and password. I'd like you to start documenting what you notice once a week. Also, if you are intrested, there are some other trials you can sign up for. Some are online so you won't even have to come down to the clinic.”

And with that, Steve was left alone once again.
